reviews.review: Absolutely Brilliant game 10/10. One of the best games i've played in all my years.
One of the best FPS and story based games ,I have played in a LONGGGG time!!!!!!  Great buy if you love twisted stories.
This game is a work of art, not only its graphics are breathtaking and the story stunning , but the characters will also leave their mark on the player.

A gorgeous and wonderful setting, high in the sky, the views are amazing - I'm in love with the aesthetic. Rather then cramped corridors and on-rails shooting, it has varied combat, large areas to explore and a lovely setting and the story ain't half bad. The gameplay is pretty gosh darn fun; however the limited arsenal (2 weapons you can hold) and some not too thrilling powers make it sometimes a chore on hard.

Such a great game, a welcomed addition to the rich world of Bioshock as it tackles subjects that while hard to face in most other media is handled in a masterful way.
9.5/10 great story very good gameplay
1999 Mode + Scavenger objective really makes it a whole new playthrough experience ... no F5 save, no F9 reload, and every item scavenged counts!
Absolutely lives up to the hype! For anyone who loves gaming, even casual gaming, a good plot or lovable characters, this is for you!
Top notch soundtrack. Great and immersive storyline. Great voice acting. One of the best games out in the market.
Shooter con una historia de ficción atrapante, te queda grabado.
Best action game I have ever played.
One of my top favorite games. Gameplay and story are absolutely phenomenal.
Amazing story. It was cut a little short though. A DLC is much needed.
GOTY

Finally a game featuring at least one character that you'll get emotionally attached to, if you don't happen to have a heart of stone. 

The gameplay has an old school- feel to it, and the game overall is rather hard, and there even is a hardcore mode, which retro gaming enthusiasts will definitely enjoy. 

If you are not a great FPS player though, I recommend playing it on easy, in order to not loose the athmosphere and story feel of the campaign to countless deaths and frustration. The story really is what makes this game.

Enjoyable game. Story is strong but then and goes off badly near the end when trying to justify the option of fighting the resistance. Very shoehorned in.

I suggest waiting till this goes on sale. You'll only be playing it once for the story.
Mind-blowing story and one of the most well-made modern games out there. Get it.
Just an incredible mind f@!# that left me wanting more.

I finished this game last week and must say a few things:
-The story is amazing.  The twist at the end blew my mind.
-The Action is a lot of fun.
-The game doesn't push much new as far as dynamics go.   
-The few new game dynamics it incorporates (Rails and summoning stuff into your world) were very cool concepts that should be explored more in future games.
-The banter between your character and Elizabeth is very well done, almost real.
-The story twist is very good.

Overall, I loved the game and recomend it to First Person Shooter fans who love a good story and pretty decent gameplay.  

For those of you that disliked BioShock 1 and 2:
Try this game.  The plodding elements are gone, this is more of a shooter than an exploratory/RPG type game that BioShock was.  I loved BioShock 1 and 2, but understand why some didn't.  This is different enough that you should give it a shot.

For those of you who love shooters, just go get it already.

Worth every penny. This competes well with The Last of Us and The Walking Dead to emotionally traumatize the most hardened gamers. Like the other two games, the conclusion is important for the shock factor. Avoid all spoilers and play alone. Immerse yourself. Enjoy.
Spectacular world, fun gameplay and a mind-blowing story, what else do you want?

A beautiful, utterly wonderful game. To rave in the way I want would risk spoiling it, but the artistic message in this game is a wonderful foil and chaser to the ones presented in Bioshock 1.

Hell, ignoring that do you have any idea how radical it is to jump from a flying railline, igniting people into flames as you land to call cover into existance as you follow up with bullets and lightning as your foes hang helplessly in the air?

Spoilers: It's hella radical.

First 3 hours amazing, last 3 hours good. Everything in between was meh. Still the same bleh combat from every other bioshock, I reccomend just youtubing it unless you really like sci fi.

Why WHYYY diddnt they just stick with alternate history. John Wilkes booth house was best part of game, downhill from there if you played it for the historical factor.
Do it!
Un must have en toda regla. No te vas a arrepentir de su compra. Completarás la saga cambiando radicalmente la lúgubre Rapture por la iluminada Columbia. ¿Te atreves a probarlo?
Playing this the day before the Fourth of July is eerie and unsettling.
Ахренительный сюжет!

***NOTE*** This Review has been edited to account for the release of all the season pass content and to get me the steam awards badge ***NOTE***

Game looks great, runs great, and is fun to play!

You develop an emotional connection to the characters and setting and will want to pick it up the moment you finish.

Gunplay is smooth, and with the Plas... I mean Vigors, you'll be able to do even more in combat.

And the Skyhook! Melee weapon and fast transport system all rolled into one, this little baby is quite an adequate replacement for your old wrench!

My one criticism is this game doesn't feel like it has as much to explore as the original Bioshock, it's very linear. You've got your one path do go down, you get to a 'hub', have your next path, then you get to a combat area. It plays very cleanly, but the exploration aspect has been minimalized here.

***EDIT*** Concerning the season pass content: When the game came out, we were promised three story DLC. In the end, we got one story DLC in two parts, and a non-story DLC with a handful of audio logs that fleshed out some of the characters a bit more. While the storyline of the DLC felt like a very appropriate farewell to the series, the season pass felt a little lacking in content for $30 ***EDIT***
EIn echt geiles Spiel. Unbedingt spielen.
One of the best games I have ever played!
Storia mozzafiato e level design magnifico... da giocare assolutamente :D

Easily one of the best games of 2013, and one of the best of the current console generation! Great characters, and a companion that actually helps you in combat without getting in the way! Great gameplay along with a great setting and a good, but potentially confusing, story for some people. Another game with an ending that will not soon be forgoten.
One of the greatest games of the generation with a beautiful, stunning world and a beautifully crafted and complex storyline. Not for people who want to be spoon feed like most. GOTY big time.

9/10

The exciting story that has been created, make's you constantly keep up playing, and with an ending that shock and confuse you, at the same time, make's you wanna play the whole game again, just to know the story correctly, so you are sure, that you haven't missed anything.

これをプレイすなら、まず先に初代ＢＩＯＨＯＣＫをすることをオススメします。
心行くまで初代をプレイしたなら満を持してＩＮＦＩＮＩＴＥをするしかありません。
初代と違い、どこまでも一本道なｹﾞｰﾑ。しかしプレイすればわかります。
一本道であるべきｹﾞｰﾑで初代の感動を再び味わえるのです。
水中から空中へ、プレイヤーからブッカーという人間へ・・・
正直、初代と今作を続けて初見でプレイ出来る人が羨ましいです。
とりあえず安くなってからでもいいから買っとけ！

追記：ＤＬＣエピソード１，２をプレイしての感想

正直、ＤＬＣだからと思ってプレイしましたが凄く良かった。クリアして思ったのは、やっぱり初代をまずプレイするのがオススメって事。ＤＬＣやるなら尚更初代をプレイするんや！

The professional reviews are overrated. This is a great game, no doubt, but not 9s and 10s great.. The twist in the end wasn't that surprising and I pretty much saw it coming. However, this is still a fantastic game. Highly recommended.

Bullet-sponge enemies, linear maps straighter than a line, horrible main characters, generic vigors, and only two equipable weapons makes this the most dissapointing game I ever bought.

Recommended to be played with the other games, play BioShock, BioShock 2, BioShock Infinite, and then the two Burial at Sea DLCs!

Fantastic way to do an escort game, gave just enough visceral thrills to keep me excited, but enough down time not to wear me out.

A solid and inoffensive first-person shooter. The characters are well developed and superbly voice acted, though the story gets a bit muddled. The art direction is fantastic, as are the set pieces in which you'll be playing. It's worth playing through once, at the very least.
overrated, easy, and a little lacking but fun.
Wow. What a great game. You should not miss this experience.
Good game, Amazing game if you loved 1 and 2!!

My thoughts, Game of the Year.... Its beautiful, its moving, and the story is great.  And for those who played the past Bioshocks, there are a few things you might see, but if not, no worries, the game is not a branch of the other BioShocks.... But you have to play this game to enjoy it... Its fluid, and smooth.... Its just a game youll get hooked from the start , to the finish as you get closer to the end, its "OMG no way.... ", kinda feeling....
Yup.

Great, thought provoking story.
Mediocre gameplay.
Beautiful environments and characters.

The last 5-10 minutes are dumb as all hell though. Don't think about the ending too much and you'll be fine. Try to analyse it and the whole plot will crumble to dust. Be warned

Overal a great game. compared to the rest of the series terrible the gameplay has been reduced to a halo clone, and Elizabeth is a terrible AI she's terrible compared to Elanor from Bioshock 2. If your a fan of the bioshock series you will hate it. But if your looking for a good game that isn't game of the year but has some fun plot twists this is for you.
The artwork & animation are beautiful, the gameplay is solid, and the story, though mind-bending, is great.

This game is simply amazing. It has everything, open maps, smart A.I.s, a realistism in it, awsome guns, lots of brutual killing and the skylines which let you zoom through the sky like your flying!!!! Irrational Games really out did themselves in this game. Its a must have!!!

AWESOME

Best Bioshock ever developed the story is endless with action and drama.
The story is amazing in a way that I never imagined. 
But the ending was very sad.
And I recommend this game to all.

I give it a 2.5 out of 10. Somewhat annoying weapons with upgrades that don't really seem to do anything, plot that does nothing for 80% of the game then has a bunch of exposition with the occasional boss battle. Lame "What a twist!" ending. Burial at Sea Episodes 1 and 2 are frustrating and short, yet boring at the same time. Both the main game and Burial at Sea both lack the replayability of the orginal Bioshock. Oh, and your choices don't matter to the story, unlike the original Bioshock.

Now that it's been a while since it was released I feel like I can now give a better opinion now that I'm no longer "blinded" in awe. The game itself is still fantasic, I give it a 9/10. There were things I wish Irrational could have done better but overall it was a great predecessor to the first 2 games. I wish that they would have given Columbia that free feeling to it like BioShock 1 and 2 had. I felt very restrained to where the story had me going and that is fine I guess, the BioShock games have always been about their story but I feel like BioShock Infinite's story was too restraining. I loved the little easter eggs with the wrench from the first game in Columbia but that's just a personal favorite. All in all it was a great game and deserves the rating it has, wasn't perfect but it was good enough to meet the standards the first 2 games set up.

Really good game , if you have the money go and buy it you won't be disappointed!
 10/10 for me

They improved the gunplay for sure compared to the other bioshock games and i like the feedback of it with the over the top gore effects.

I never understand why devs think that a weapon limit in videogames is needed, especially a limit where u can carry only 2 weapons ... like WTF WHY? 

The game has some cool and unique enemies to offer, which sadly appear almost never in the game or very rarely.

Still it's worth the experience and has it's moments.

I bought this game for its asthetic look, I was not disapointed. I spent most of the game walking around the city of Columbia- Searching every house and open door. I'd recommend this game just for that! Not to mention the gameplay though, It's fantastical and the storyline is so fine tuned and perfect
I cannot think of a reason you shouldn't be playing this game right now! The only thing that can improve it, Is D.L.C.

And Burial At Sea Episode One? - I wish there was INFINITE episodes! It was totally spectacular, Graphically and Gameplay wise. It's cleverly devised and connected to the first Bioshocks, which I haven't even played! But now I feel like I have!

I cannot recomend this game more then I already have, It's a TOTAL must BUY.
Worth every penny you pay.
Un jeu magnifique. Vivement un mode nue pour Elizabeth <3
Anyone who knows me know how much I love Bioshock. The environment in this one are a lot more colourful and full of life, but boy is the story just as twisted as the two previous ones. A must have!

This game is brilliant in so many ways, and definitely makes up for bioshock 2. It is stunning visually, the storyline is incredibly well written, the gameplay is rewardingly challenging when you notch up the difficulty, and most importantly it is closer to the fun, non realistic, FPS games that we used to enjoy rather than being another call of duty copy. Even if you haven't played the previous games this one is worth checking out!

One of the best games I have ever played. Great story and gameplay, insane level of detail that I didn't fully notice until my second playthrough, and you can pop people's heads. 10/10 wish I could erase my memory of it and play it again new.

Great characters, awesome story, jaw-dropping visuals. Environments start off filled with citizens with no real interaction... eventually they are gone from the city (feels lazy/lame,) and all you encounter are bad guys. Flawed / boring combat system (compared to Bioshock1.) Tears leave a lot to be desired. Wished certain elements of the story took a greater part in the game. The companion system is executed well. Despite my complaints, this is a really great game and worth a play through.
Game of the year for 2013, hands down..
